alert.note: Alert for Lake; Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 20 at 11:25AM EST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kankakee River at Shelby affecting Newton and Lake IN Counties. For the Kankakee River...including Shelby...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR AN ICE JAM REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Kankakee River from Near I-65 and De Motte downstream to IL/IN state line, including the Shelby gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying overbank and forest areas between the Illinois Indiana state line and Shelby. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CST Saturday the stage was 9.7 feet. Local officials have reported near bankfull conditions near the Illinois Indiana state line and near Shelby. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near bankfull while the ice jam remains in place. - Flood stage is 10.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 430 AM CST.
